Please note the following:

• This board desires high quality discussion. High quality posts will be praised. Low quality posts e.g. "Is this paranormal?" or "I am [insert paranormal entity here] ask me anything," etc. will be removed.
• Requests belong on >>>/wsr/.
• Conspiracy theories are welcome, but anything political in nature should be posted to >>>/pol/.
• For everything else, refer to global and board-specific rules.

Welcome to Divination General! Come here for readings and a discussion of theory/practice.

Every method is welcome: Tarot, Runes, Cartomancy, Scrying, Pendulum, Cleromancy, I-Ching, Oracles, Tasseomancy, Necromancy, etc.

>If you're NEW, please READ the STICKY:
http://pastebin.com/2Wp1Q074 (embed)

>Recommended /div/ links and books:
https://pastebin.com/sAkg9cMz (embed)

>MEGA with Divination Books:
https://mega.nz/folder/Jp8gQD7Q#om_2lEm1GL0qPIpSrQgrvA

>Guides made by some of our readers:
•Rustig on how to start with tarot:
http://i.imgur.com/2rodLWB.png (embed)

•Thoth's tarot and rune guide:
https://docs.google.com/document/d/1ciFuMOVDIkA18d9Rw-Zkklgigx-Y4XzJkGVeMTYWcic/edit?pref=2&pli=1

•Hijinks' revised divination guide:
https://pastebin.com/Gv10KZUA (embed)

>Useful tips before posting:
•If you're a reader post that you're offering readings and what information is required from the querent; same goes for trading.
•Look for posts to determine if there's an active reader, what's needed and before posting, check if they finished reading already.
•Some readers will refuse to do certain readings - respect that choice. Do not harass readers if your query is refused/skipped.
•Traders should respect that a traded read will be granted, as per an agreement of trade. Free readers have the option of picking their queries.
•Bullshit queries will get bullshit answers. Same for vague queries.
•Making an AQ (air query) by not addressing a reader, in particular, is possible but doesn't guarantee an answer.
•Avoid making the same query repeatedly and/or to different readers in a short period of time, as this may lead to more confusion.
•Provide feedback when applicable and be considerate to the reader. We're a growing community, many readers are starting and need to know what they are doing right or wrong. Let's help each other to improve.

posts.sub: Why is no one interested in the most fundamental question?
posts.com:
Does anyone subscribe to any particularly compelling theories as to why the universe exists?

It seems to me that the most interesting question that could ever be answered is why the universe (or anything) exists at all or why does it exist any one particular way not any other way.

It seems to me that this problem is equally and issue for theists and atheists alike. Theists have their god that created the universe but why there's a god at all is never explained.

After thinking about it, no matter what the answer is, it is way beyond anything human understanding can likely even touch. It's the most magical magic, the most miraculous miracle. It is by definition that, because it can't be anything mundane.

You have to understand where I'm coming from, I spent my of my life being very rigidly scientific and scoffed at anything remotely "woo" at all. This has changed the most I thought about the reason for the existence of everything.

I even would hypothesize that the close we get to understanding this question the close we get to gaining unlimited power either spiritually or materially if that makes sense. Just thing about it, how could it not?

>>33928791
"Why" is an English representation of a recursive function with a structure and termination point.

why(x) = z

There's a difference between asking the question: why(existence), the question itself: the infinite nature of why(x), and the overlying superstructure that governs the structure of all questions: a multidimensional dynamic.

That question - "why?"- sheds one sliver of light on the bars of a cage that is embedded within an overall reality. It brings you no closer to your real goal. Answers to that question are only the cold feeling of those bars against the palm of your hand.

Eventually, you'll touch enough bars to recognize the cage. Sooner for some. Others will never notice that part of them die that they didn't know existed, and will convince themselves that the bars represent an infinity that they are bound to revere.

How does one reach beyond the bars? There's a part of you that can, and will, and is.

Hi OP.
Have you been around lately ? People are dumb. By their own choices, they chose shackle themselves with unnecessary burdens, unnecessary vices, unnecessary relationships so they can have a "worthy life".

On the other hand, I almost went insane taking shrooms and trying to answer this question. And I don't consider myself stupid, so I concluded that we were not made to answer that question. Like the characters of a show, we are just here to play our roles.

Have you watched Everything Everywhere All At Once ? Most people think it's a crazy kung fu movie, others might see the family story. I saw what it was like to be God. Not in a "old dude in the sky" way, but in a "I have omnipotence". I have all point of views. I see, hear, touch, smell, hear, feel all the things through all those things.

We are the universe experiencing itself. All is mind. You know the idea.

So as to why the universe exists ?

Without my other, there wouldn’t be me; for the fluctuation of our connecting thread is what births the waves of chaos that in controlled randomness create all. The distance between the ends of the thread grows shorter, does the vibration trembling between them quiet down? What am I, who am I; who is he? I’m plagued by the questions that are only answered in certainty of faith, in absolute knowledge that they are heard, and answered, but it’s not the answers that I truly seek. It is freedom to see, to feel; to touch, to hold, to be united. It is not here where I am, but it is the one I’ve always known to be.

I wonder how many times we’ve done this already?

Is it just us, or are there others?

How does this work? I beg of you to tell me, I plead that you enter my dreams and show your face; show me how you know my face, tell me again of us. I feel that I’ve known and forgotten it so many times, but this time, this time I’ll remember. I’ll hold onto it and never let go.

I’m going to escape this place and be with you again; you whose name I do not know, you whose face I do not see, but you, who are why I am.

This is what is known even before it is known.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>33931022
https://ine.uaf.edu/projects/wtc7/

The UAF research team utilized three approaches for examining the structural response of WTC 7 to the conditions that may have occurred on September 11, 2001. First, we simulated the local structural response to fire loading that may have occurred below Floor 13, where most of the fires in WTC 7 are reported to have occurred. Second, we supplemented our own simulation by examining the collapse initiation hypothesis developed by the National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST). Third, we simulated a number of scenarios within the overall structural system in order to determine what types of local failures and their locations may have caused the total collapse to occur as observed.

The principal conclusion of our study is that fire did not cause the collapse of WTC 7 on 9/11, contrary to the conclusions of NIST and private engineering firms that studied the collapse. >You're looking at a reflection of creation; Yod, then Heh, then Vav, then Heh, as an elemental process at the culmination of which is "Theo pneustas" or "God Breathed" either for the creation of man or the incarnation of the godman or his ministry.
Reuchlin continues the thought of Nicholas of Cusa and Albertus Magnus, Cusa uses a Tetracys to describe a part of his system, specifically the Neoplatonist Emanationist system
A - Monad (1)
BC - Nous (3)
DEF -Anima (9)
HIJK - Nature (27)
The () numbers i've added are the numbers he uses as he's very 'Neopythagorean', each number after 1 are the former number times 3, 1 + 3 + 9 + 27 = 40, this is how he explains the importance of the number 40 in the Bible (akin to how Kabbalists see 40 as the 10 Sephirotic in each one of the 4 Worlds combined)
Reuchlin just took that and saw it through his ''''Kabbalistic'''' point of view

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>33931132
Bhante gunaratana isn't really post canonical, he's actually more canonical then a lot of modern mindfulness teachers secularization the practice.
https://www.vipassana.com/meditation/mindfulness_in_plain_english.html
If you're utilizing anapanasati, don't go for meditation apps. Go straight to the source. Helps a lot to understand mindfulness, you need to start incorporating the meditation into your daily activities as well. Keep up the sila as well. If you have the 8fold path down, it comes together like dominos.
If something in your practice is out of line, then your meditation won't get anywhere. Getting anywhere with anapana, it helps to understand satipatthana as well.
If you want more in depth on satipatthana so you can utilize the teaching gunaratana puts forth for anapana, check analayo's book on satipatthana practice.
Right now I'm using the skeleton, it's leading to some bizarre mental images. Incredibly useful to developing mindfulness and going past lust.

Anyway you probably feel like you're spinning your wheels because you are. Meditation apps are (largely) by grifters trying to make a buck selling you microincrement gains on productivity. Yuck.

posts.com:
Seeing as what I said struck a chord for some people, I thought I might as well elaborate.
The reason why in very many magical traditions, including this one, you are told that your first attempts are to bring forth things that bring little conflict of interest to your sensibilities (manifesting a ladder, for example), is because our craft relies on acceptance.The reason for feeling guilt, sadness, despair, and pity when trying to manifest something has nothing to do with the thing you want not being what you truly desire; that step was overcome the moment you selected the topic for manifestation. You, right here and right now, are the master, and the master will do as he pleases.
The issue is acceptance. Acceptance of the self in mind, body, and spirit. You do not feel worthy; you do not feel deserving. Doubt, fear, and intrusive thoughts will fit this lack of confidence, and now you see that this problem has nothing to do with weakness but with our preference to stick to a certain set of habits and thought patterns.To fix this, do not leave yourself at the mercy of your guilt, surrendering your impulses to the mercy of your untamed unconscious, but rather, do what a parent should do: guide it by example.Form new habits: brush your teeth after every meal, take baths at a certain time and place, meditate for a specific amount of time after a set number of days, and teach the child within that it too can take part in your activities to the point that you find yourself holding the toothbrush in the bathroom without any concrete idea of why you are there.Once you have structured a habit of your choosing, you are to introduce the child within to the habit of accepting only the good thoughts and feelings born of your mind, and in time, you will no longer find yourself waking up to worries and imaginary perils, but to the palpable wonders and abilities brought by good reason and ever-so-helpful insight.Read this twice if need be, keep it secret, and keep it close.

Thank about the time you want to go back to. Make sure it's close to the change you want to make- ideally it's a decision. The example I gave was if you were in a bad car accident, you want to jump in before that and decide not to get in the car.

All you should need to do is identify the time/place you want to go back to and believe yourself there. 1 change, that's all you get.

To start off, I am playing "devil's advocate" here and do not actually wish that we are in a devil's world. But I want to ask the question, why do all religions assume that we're in a good world, with the potential for a good afterlife? One reason I see is that it is very comforting to believe there is something beautiful waiting after the suffering and horror that is dying. It's like these religions have spread and survived on this promise, but how do we know this is a real promise and not the promise of a scammer? All religious texts read like rhetoric

>for the illiterate who would have to google rhetoric: "the art of effective or persuasive speaking or writing, especially the use of figures of speech and other compositional techniques."

Every religious text feels like it's trying to persuade you. "I'm right, the others are wrong." How does one find truth when everyone is pointing fingers at each other calling each other wrong?

When you think about life, we are designed to keep on going despite the horrors around us. If sex was not pleasurable, nobody would bother bringing anyone into this horrible world where we are destined to decay and fall apart. If eating was not pleasurable, we would stop eating quickly and wither and die. Without sex and eating being pleasurable, this game falls apart. It's like we're designed this way to be farmed for something. This design makes me feel like we are more likely cattle to a greater being than something loved.

Or worse, this is just a science experiment for a god who is a failure among gods. Unable to find a "mate", our god is an incel who had to divide himself into millions of organisms to have sex with himself. Our entire existence, is masturbation for a single god.

Or even worse, we are all Satan divided into all human lives and deaths endlessly. We are given life and a glimmer of hope and love, but by the end of life we suffer and see all of our loved ones suffer and fall apart...punishment for eternity.

>>33916730
I did an ambulance ride along once. During the ride along we got a call for an altered level of consciousness cancer patient. We got in after the medics, she looked sick, had no hair, pale etc, and she was fighting the NPA they were putting in as we walked through the door. The family was explaining that she had a DNR they couldnt find but without the document, it didnt matter. The odor of the house was very distinct, sort of like shit, but not exactly. Cancer smell. So we packed her up. At first I thought she was mad at me as I was trying to take her vitals but at some point I realized my presence there, as some meek and useless observer, taunted her. There I was, young, fit, in my white collared shirt, life ahead of me to do whatever I wanted, and here she was, getting ventilated despite having a DNR. We weren't even letting her die the way she wanted. She just locked eyes with me, with her big dilated pupils and dark brown eyes. Staring staring staring like black holes. I stared back into them for a while, just watching. I felt like there was some anger there, but there was an emptiness to her eyes as well, like looking into space.

I got a blood pressure of maybe 60 something over nothing, she had a pulse only in her carotid from what I could tell. The guys told me to stick around at the hospital so maybe I could do CPR on her and "get to feel the bones crunch" but she just laid there in the bed staring at me from 25 feet away. Her eyes boring holes into me from far across the room. Just fixated on me and me alone.

I mention this because after watching Hereditary I remembered the event very vividly, specifically the womans eyes. For an hour or so immediately after the film, I was somewhat disturbed.

I believe I went and had a beer and a cheeseburger and felt much better immediately, but yes, I distinctly remember this film bringing back a traumatic experience from my past to the forefront of my attention. Makes sense if you think about it.

Question:

>What do you eat in a day as a raw vegan?

Answer:

NO MEAT, NO DAIRY, NO CHEESE, NO WHEAT, NO GRAINS, NO PASTA, NO BREAD, NO RICE, NO OATS, NO OIL

This means that you will be eating 100% raw fruits, vegetables and nuts.

Part of your journey is learning what YOU like to eat that is raw and healthy.

You will have to learn to make your own salads and dressings that are tasty with flavors that appeal to you. It will take a lot of experimentation on your part to find out what flavors are appealing for you to eat- day by day.

Here is a beginner shopping list:

>A couple 1 pound boxes of dark leafy greens of your choice (kale, spinach, argula, chard, romaine)
(you have to eat at least a pound of greens a day)
>A couple bunches of bananas for smoothies and eating
>Unsweetened almond milk
>Raw nuts (a lot of nuts are roasted and have oil in them. Make sure to read the label to get nuts that are raw, uncooked and have no oil on them)
-Raw nuts part 2: Try out raw cashews, walnuts, almonds
>Raw seeds: Raw sunflower seeds, raw pumpkin seeds
>Blueberries or any type of berries you want
>red onion, cucumbers, tomatoes, red cabbage ( if you like it), avocados, carrots all for salad toppings
>Dates for eating and for smoothies
>Distilled water and stop drinking tap water or filtered water. Distilled water only.


Remember the majority of what you will be eating will be salad. If you don't eat at least a pound of dark leafy greens a day- you will be very hungry! But honestly try to aim for 1.5-2 pounds of dark leafy green salad a day. That means you will be going through almost two huge containers a day. (edited)
Your average meal will be- a 1 pound salad made with cashew dressing or some other raw dressing with a lot of toppings... A banana almond milk smoothie made with dates and blueberries or something else...

That's it!

I'm not really into paranormal stuff but I just remembered a really weird and unexplained experience I had about 3,5 years ago when I had just turned 18

My family has friends in Switzerland and while on vacation there me and my brother decided to take a hike to a scenic pass at about ~ 2800 meters elevation and camp on a small patch of grass with a nearby mountain lake just underneath the pass.

We had lot's of fun traversing gravel fields and a small ice field almost like a mini glacier. We reached the pass and quickly descended as to set up our tent before the sun would go down leaving us in total darkness.

The originial goal was to look at the stars as we are city folk and not used to seeing many stars due too light pollution.

Turns out we could see the whole milky way with more stars than we could possibly count and we spent hours in the cold outside of the tent just staring into the sky until our necks would become stiff.

We finally fell asleep but I soon woke up at around 3 am.

Here is where the scary part begins.
As I exited the small tent I could see several bright lights in the distanced. Seemingly moving at a very slow speed.

My first thought was those are probably headlamps of climbers but that made no sense for the following reasons :

- This area was very secluded, not touristy and we had encountered NOBODY in the ~ 8 hours we had been walking up before setting up the then

- The highest peek surrounding the area is only 3000 meters tall so it would not attract any serious climbers. They usually go for those over 4000 meters.

- Usually climbers start early in the morning but I never heard of climbers going out in the middle of the night

- The lights seemed to change speed eratically and sometime would change directions

-Some lights would vanish only for one or 2 more to pop up just minutes later in a different place

I got very creeped out and started thinking about "Irrlichter"

https://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Irrlicht

>>33922737
What the signal is? Thats fairly easy. Its an artificially frequency modulated data stream. What data is contained in there is another matter entirely

If this were purely earth based, lets pretend its a ship at sea for a moment, then to me it looks like an S.O.S beacon. Its a standard modulated signal, at an easy to capture frequency containing a short pattern that repeats. It's extremely easy to grow them in your back yard. Then you dry them, grind them in a blender, and steep them in hot water. I use a pot on the stove top. I wrap the ground poppy straw in a cloth before boiling. You can and should do multiple extractions, as one or even two will leave useful alkaloids behind. Here's the redpill: don't drink the tea, it's horrible. Instead pour it in another pot and evaporate the water off on high heat. Turn it down to low at the very end though so you don't burn the residue. When you have only black sticky goo left, scrape it up with a spoon and make balls by wrapping swallowable sized chunks of goo in rolling papers. Then swallow like a pill. If you do it right you won't taste a thing. Seems to radically reduce the nausea as well. Total game changer

Among this is the dating of the fall of Atlantis as related to and from Plato, about 9k years before Solon's time (c9600 BC, 11,600kya). This coincides with meltwater pulse 1b of the roughly thousand year younger dryas climate catastrophe. Further the mass of ice that existed in North America alone would have been nearly equal to that of Antarctica before the younger dryas, a near equal mass was also over Europe. The geographic evidence of the younger dryas melt pulses points to mind bogglingly fast melting, previously thought to have been centuries or millennia has been revised down to months of years recently (in some studies, weeks). This rapid melting of such large masses of ice would have mostly drained into the Atlantic, it would change the thermocline and haloclines of the entire world ocean rapidly and immediately altered the climate. It would have also rapidly changed the isostasy of the Earth's crust under the Atlantic in particular and raised local sea levels much more rapidly than previously thought. These are merely results however, of a precursor event that triggered the massive melting and climate shift (whether caused from the sun, the Earth itself, or from a passing or impacting comet or asteroid or something else).

The evidence of catastrophism are all about us, in our sight daily. Even mainstream science accepts many events reluctantly. So, are you falling at 4.5 miles per minute, 3 miles per minute, 1.1 miles per minute, or 0.57 miles per minute?

What if you looked at how far you actually dropped in 1 minute, instead of extrapolating from how far you dropped in 1 hour? 8*(1040/60)^2 /63360 = 0.037 miles of drop in 1 minute. That's not 200ft a SECOND, that's 195 feet per MINUTE. You're off by a factor of 60 already.

The fact that smoking is bad for you is pretty evident, and even a basic understanding of biology should make it intuitive that inhaling smoke into your lungs is going to damage them. Anyways time for some more interesting theories. First of all, nicotine is definitely capable of improving the brain. It's a fast acting stimulant, and works on acetylcholine rather than dopamine like other stimulants do. Excess dopamine can be neurotoxic, but elevated acetylcholine is neuroprotective, and specifically improves memory and creativity. It's a subtly benefit, not aggressive like amphetamines, but I've noticed I work better after taking nicotine, and will often use nicotine gum when I need a mental boost.

Another theory is related to the social component of smoking. There are very few times for people to just exist and talk in American society, especially with people outside your immediate family. The smoke break was one of these times, where multiple people would go outside together and just talk, all while under the influence of a substance that enhances cognition. The only other common time people talk with strangers is under the influence of alcohol which numbs cognition. Basically, by demonizing smoking, another avenue for people who normally would never meet to communicate was removed, and the remaining ways to meet people involve the use of substances which make you stupider, not smarter.

Although you are good at understanding and empathizing with others, you may have probably avoided doing your own inner work on yourself. You probably hold lots of fears, guilt and anxieties, which may come from overreactive imagination.
There are problems with being spontaneous and carefree in life. You likely take life a lot more seriously than others, feeling like you're one of the few mature person than those around you. Your inner child likely feels shackled, unable to be the child you wish to be. The child within you that wishes to be free and playful, to enjoy life for what it is. Learn how to enjoy the more fun things in life. Embrace your inner child.
Learning to step back from the details and look at the bigger picture will be important for you. You are inquisitive, curious, accumulating many random information and experiences within your memory. You have a inclination towards philosophy and the higher learning of the more spiritual variety. Your life will feel more fulfilling once you are able to trust in your intuition and apply your mind to the greater meanings of life and the universe.

Tell me the harm of taking oregeno oil every day.
Oregano oil has numerous potential health benefits, however taking it every day can also be harmful. Long-term use of oregano oil can cause stomach upset, nausea, and vomiting. Oregano oil can also cause allergic reactions when applied to the skin. In some cases, it can irritate the skin and cause redness and itching. High doses of oregano oil can also cause headaches, dizziness, and confusion. Prolonged use of oregano oil can also lead to an abnormal increase in liver enzymes, and should not be used if you have any liver or kidney disease.
It is best to speak to your doctor before taking oregano oil every day, as they will be able to advise you on the best course of action.
can oregeno oil damage your stomach?
Yes, taking oregano oil every day can potentially damage your stomach. Long-term use of oregano oil can cause stomach upset, nausea, and vomiting. High doses can also lead to an abnormal increase in liver enzymes, and should not be used if you have any liver or kidney disease. posts.name: St. Esprit
posts.sub: Une Horreur aux débuts des Sources de La Vie
posts.com:
Parfois certains désirant avoir une vie normale et rien de plus, se retrouvent dans un système de jeu de torture psychologique :

Je vous livre en plusieurs parties ce que j'ai réellement vécu, et je balance tout sans aucun filtre :

Pour ma part j'ai commencé à tout comprendre en 2017 à Voiron, mais au départ je ne comprends pas tout ce qu'il se passe.
puisque le macabre piège des CDP* dans lequel on m'a ernfermé, avait commencé 2 ans plus tot (je reparlerai des CDP plus tard...)
Au départ je commencais à remarquer que TOUTES les femmes -que j'aimais et regardais dans la rue- s'effacaient de ma mémoire (surtout celles qui étaient mon style de femmes) :
Le soir en rentrant chez moi j'essayais de me souvenir de certaines, mais soit elles avaient une tache à la place du visage, soit déformés par une spirale
(comme les filtres des réseaux sociaux, mais là c'était non pas des photos MAIS mes propres souvenirs, dans mon cerveau qui avait ces images comme modifiées
A ce moment là, seul chez toi, tu commence à entendre des voix du style : "t'as vu ce qu'il a en mémoire ? Bien plus de filles que de femmes"
C'est là ou tu te demande si tu deviens parano, ou si c'est ton imagination, ou si tu deviens fou
Malheureusement tu te rends compte que ca ne peut pas ètre le cas, parce que ca recommence le lendemain, le surlendemain, plusieurs voix différentes (et "encore distinctes" les unes des autres à cette époque là)
Tu les entends faire des commentaires sur ce que tu regarde a la TV, où d'autres phrases de ce genre
Etant l'été les fenètres ouvertes, tu te dis que peut-ètre tu dois entendre les voisins, les murs sont peu épais, donc pourquoi pas
Puis tu commence à réaliser que les voix correspondent bien à celles de tes voisins, de ceux du bar qui est juste en bas de chez toi
Malheureusement, plus t'essaie de te souvenir des femmes que tu croise moins t'y arrive, et plus tu te retrouve avec des filles à la place... L'Horreur commence ...

posts.name: St. Esprit
posts.com:
A peu près à la mème époque, (sachant que tout ce qui est dit au dessus continue tous les jours sans cesse ...), je remarque que des gens commencent à me regarder de travers dans la rue ...
Surtout moi qui habitait pile en face d'un bar quand je sortais du hall d'entrée ... les regards silencieux figés sur toi quand j'étais de face, puis les murmures quand ils sont dans mon dos ...
J'y ai cru que ce n'était que mon imagination, puis plus le temps passe plus c'est insistant ... jusqu'au jour ou j'entende clairement de l'intérieur du bar : "Alors c'est lui le pédo ?" ...
Malheureusement je me suis dis qu'ils sont tous fous de croire une rumeur pareille , et qu'en laissant tasser les choses, les gens se rendront compte qu'ils se sont trompés...
2e malheureusement, et l'erreur que j'ai faite à cet époque, c'est de ne pas couper les ponts avec des jeunes que j'avais connu (parce que adulescent) avant de déménager de La Buisse :
Parce que j'ai appris bien plus tard, que l'un des 2 jeunes que je cottoie encore aujourd'hui, était un pur menteur et manipulateur (appelons le Elliott) ... Mais j'en reparlerai plus tard
Du coup c'était pire jour après jours (autant les femmes qui m'étaient effacées que le reste continuait sans cesse )...
et contrairement à ce que je croyais (que ça allait se tasser) , la rumeur entrainée par les piliers du bar, et par ce Elliott, ont fait que ma vie était finie à ce moment là. Mais ce n'était que le début ...

>>33930793
Bizarement, tout ce que je savais à cette époque là, c'était que la pire des rumeurs trainait sur mon dos, et qu'ils arrivaient à savoir ce que j'avais comme image en souvenirs, mais pas ce que je pensais
En d'autres termes c'est comme si je les entendais, mais que eux n'entendaient pas mes pensées. Mais ce que je ne savais pas c'est que ca allait monter en intensité mois après mois, pendant 6 ans
J'ai commencé à comprendre qu'ils n'obtenaient pas ce qu'ils voulaient de moi, lorsque je les entendaient chercher ce à quoi je pensais, dés que je fermais les yeux.
Etonnamant au bout d'un certain temps ca me faisait beaucoup moins peur, et j'essayais de jouer avec eux pour voir s'ils reconnaissaient ce a quoi je pensais.
C'est à peu près au mème moment que j'ai commencé à leur répondre à voix haute dans mon appart ; mais pas à tous :
- Entre ceux qui scrutaient le moindre mouvement de mes yeux sur le moindre enfant apparaissant dans la TV et qui ne relevaient jamais les femmes , à qui je ne répondais jamais,
- Ceux qui commentaient simplement ce que je faisais, a tout instant , à qui je répondais une fois de temps en temps
- Et ceux qui étaient cool, qui avaient compris que j'étais un inocent qui s'était fait avoir, et qui essayaient de me rassurer (avec qui on riait un peut de tout et rien ... parfois)
Je sais maintenant que si j'avais parlé de ca à l'époque on m'aurait traité de fou. Mais c'est plus pareil, il y a les preuves et les témoignages aujourd'hui (mème si "l'Esprit Sceptique" dit qu'un témoignage n'est pas une preuve)...
...(à suivre)...

posts.name: St. Esprit
posts.com:
>>33931504
Mais je ne pensais pas à ca, j'était trop étouffé par tout ce que j'ai dit au dessus qui continuait de se produire inlassablement tous les jours...
Jusqu'à ce que les CDP me disent que : les images des femmes : ils les effacaient volontairement, mais que les faux souvenirs des filles que je ne voyais mème pas,
ils les enregistraient et les montraient aux gens dans la rue, en faisant croire que c'était des images sur mon pc ...
Plus ils répandaient leurs rumeurs, plus ils m'éffacaient tout ce qui se rapporte aux femmes, plus ils ne détournaient mon attention que sur les filles, plus ils me forcaient à avouer -sous la contrainte- que je n'aimais pas les femmes
A ce moment là, si la torture psychologique est trop forte, tu fini par dire ce qu'ils veulent entendre, et les CDP ont gagné : ils finiront par faire de toi ce pour quoi ils ont lancé les rumeurs, inocent ou pas.
Mais ce n'est jamais arrivé, vu que j'ai toujours refusé d'avouer ce qu'ils veulent puisque c'était, et c'est toujours faux. Malheureusement ils rabachaient sans cesse que je mentais sans avancer aucune preuve.
Plus le temps passait et plus chaque jour était le recommencement de la veille en un petit peu plus insistant, et plus ils finissaient par décoder de plus en plus ce que je pensais une fois les yeux fermés.
Et dire qu'à ce moment je me disais qu'ils devaient surement analyser les mouvements de ma paupière une fois les yeux fermès, pour finir par tomber de plus en plus juste sur ce que je pensais ...

posts.name: St. Esprit
posts.com:
>>33932259
Toujours avec cette routine quotidienne, un jour ma cousine me demande de faire un film sur un cd (étant un geek) pour les 18 ans de sa fille avec pleins de photos d'elle de la naissance a ses 18 ans.
Ca a été la dégringolade ... plus j'avancais dans le montage de son film, plus j'entendais les voix devenir folles, au point de croire que j'enregistrait les photos d'une fille que j'avais ken.
Ca aurait pu en rester là mais non ... lors du trajet en voiture jusqu'à chez ma cousine le jour mème, je me retrouve avec une dixaine de voitures qui me doublent et repassent derrière moi sur l'autoroute, tout le long du trajet.
Surtout avec les visages des adultes qui, lorsqu'ils me doublaient , ralentissaient à ma hauteur pour bien me fusiller du regard.
A voir un tel défilé de cons qui tournent autour de moi comme des vautours ... maintenant j'en rierai presque mais un rire très amère.
Tout ca parce qu'un imbécile à cru un jour (2ans avant, soit en 2015) que j'étais un PDC (PeDoCriminel) et a lancé la rumeur à plus d'une centaine de personnes...
Et une fois la rumeur lancée, il fallait qu'elle soit rentabilisée, donc ce ne sont plus les foules ou des passants qui prennent le relais mais les CDP (Createurs De Pedos) Pour forcer la personne à devenir comme les rumeurs disent.
...

posts.name: St. Esprit
posts.com:
>>33932951
Après plusieurs mois à recevoir en boucle les mèmes questions et les mèmes harcelements ... J'ai commencé à péter un plomb et ai voulu voir du pays (un tour de France en voiture) juste au moment ou j'ai déménagé.

Au bout d'un moment (près d'un an), ils ont commencé à enregistrer nos conversations, mais bien entendu à l'écrit ... il ne fallait évidement pas dire qu'ils communiquaient avec moi sans pc ni écran ni ornet !
Mais j'ai appris bien après, que tout ce qu'ils ont mis par écrit, contenait des mots disons "inversés" (femmes à la place de fille et vice versa, ou j'aime et j'aime pas, ou perdu et gagné, ou vérité et mensonge)
ou le plus fourbe : les négations qu'ils mettent quand je n'en disais pas et qu'ils enlèvent quand je les disais ... Mais par contre les "oui" et "non" ne sont pas inversés...
esample : ils me disent qu'ils enregistrent et me posent la question : "Tu aime les femmes ?" (sachant que j'avais la version inversée, donc je recevais : "Tu n'aime pas les femmes ?")
Si tu réponds non, ils gardent la version vocale et disent prouver que tu ne les aiment pas, mais si tu dis oui, ils te laissent la version écrite inversée, et disent prouver que tu ne les aiment pas.
Puis ils insistent en te demandant : "Alors c'est les filles ou les femmes que t'aimes ?" et idem que pour la 1ère question, si tu réponds "femmes" ils enregistreront à l'écrit l'inverse,
et si par malheur tu te dis qu'en leur disant "fille" ils enregistrent l'inverse , détrompe toi, puisqu'ils enregistrent ta voix qui prononce ce qu'ils voulaient t'entendre dire...

>>33928165
I have a few simple methods which I have discovered by accident. First of all you are going to want to stock up on dream enhancing substances, such as wormwood, Vitamin B6, melatonin and huperzine to name a few. If you want an utterly terrifying and alien experience you could try a mushroom microdose. Do some research and see what works for you. You will also need some moderate stimulant such as coffee or something slightly stronger depending on how you respond to it. But the point is it should be strong enough to keep you awake generally speaking, but not strong enough to keep you out of a state of fatigue. So here is the method.
Get yourself to become mildly sleep deprived. Either get 2-3 hours of sleep nightly over the course of a few days, or pull an all nighter or two. (Do not overdo it. Seriously, do not push yourself to the point where you become delirious. That will do lasting damage to your brain and also it won't work if you do) Then once you are utterly exhausted take your dream enhancing substances an hour or two before you plan to sleep and your stimulant 45 to 30 minutes before. The idea is that you must be so exhausted that your body can't resist falling asleep and stimulated enough so that you can't properly fall asleep. IF it works (It might not) don't expect to be in control. I have fallen into sleep paralysis over 10 times and I have never been able to fully control it. My body ALWAYS assumes a sort of fight or flight panic and my heart beats like a mother fucker. Even when I have prepared extensively I get too frightened to be in control. I don't want to lucid dream or astral project because I am terrified, I just want to leave the dream state.

>>33929277
The difference between the right hand path and the lefthand path is in its bare essence two aspects:
the question between egalitarianism and elitism, and the question of tradition/nominalism vs gnosis/immanence.
Fundamentally what you want to do from how you write is an egalitarian result with arbitrary means.
Ironically this Will converge you to a right hand path form of satanism.
>right hand path satanism
>there is such a thing???
Yes. This is the great irony.
Any religion you can read in a book is INHERENTLY written in a book. By its very nature. This means that the book was written by someone for an audience.
When you are reading it, you ARE the audience. And therefore you are an initiate and follow a tradition which is always a right hand path thing to do. And since you are egalitarian you are firmly on the right hand path in both method and purpose.

The lefthand path means freedom for its own sake, and ascension over the masses and an approach to peaks most people could never ever possibly know.
I am your total opposite.
I am inherently a gnostic elitist, but I just use the absolute as my source and keep my hands clear from all demonic and evil entities.
This is a firm left hand path position, even though I do not practice anything overtly occult.
So yea maybe this gives you some insight.

The lefthand path is not something you can choose as a flavor. It is something you have to strive towards on your own without guidance and it is going to be hard. You have to see and interact with the forces that be and walk alone.

Now, that being said this gives the impression that the left hand path is not approachable for you.
That is actually not the case because what I have described is based on my own description.
You see, the left hand path is different for everyone. I have a very constrained practice that is very hard to pull off in this way because the absolute is my only source.

Cont.

>>33933151
>where is the contradiction
Well perhaps I misread you.
The biggest paradox of the benevolent luciferian is this: how can you govern those who are beneath you?
At some point you WILL start viewing people as cattle for their ignorance, there is no escape. And make no mistake, this is not your fault, contrast this with how Jesus calls himself the good Sheppard.
A Sheppard is leading sheep.
So how can you be a good Sheppard when you are now so different from the sheep?
And when you attain a position where this conclusion becomes inevitable, how do you stave of the doom which is when you decide to just treat them like animals?
Many Fall for it, this is what is called the indigopill. once you attain enough gnostic knowledge the average person becomes nothing to you.
So how can you strive for them?
A simple answer that many also give is to uplift them. But if you are stringent and not willfully blind to this horrible reality you must come to understand that for them there is no salvation. You can not save them. They will never understand.

You are given the insight, you are given the light but you can never share it.
Or only flickers of it in the smallest corners, and even that only to the fewest few.
So how will you strive for the greater good?
Whose greater good?
And what is even the value in it?
An answer at this point might be to just strive towards the absolute and trust that in striving towards it, you will also save everyone by its mercy.
But this is hard, you know?
And to arrive at the end of this path if you are just striving towards the greater good seems to me somewhat far fetched as the trials that await you are inherently those which question what to strive for, you can not begin with this foregone conclusion.
Well this is hard to say, but I hope I made clear in which sense there is a contradition. The contradiction is only in form and path not necessarily in result.
Also take note that this is my own experience with the absolute as my source.

>Is a king not above his subjects? Yet he is able to govern them.
A king is not the one who imposes the framework of governance. In a very real sense absolute monarchy is governance by god as the king justifies his reign by divine right.
A king, a democracy and even a company all have a metaphysics which justifies their right to rule. Which is always a right hand path codified philosophy or religion.
Be it property rights, be it divine right or majority rule. All of this are right hand path popularity held beliefs which uphold the structure.
Now you are a left hand path practitioner.
You can NOT by your very nature gain justification to rule by your own rules as this justification can not fly with other people.
This is the same as how you can not just order a rock to move.
Or just walk up to people and arbitrarily tell them what to do.

And if you take this to a logical conclusion - even just doing it through power, you are using preexisting structures as a proxy to project your will.
You are not doing it on your own terms.

So the real question is: how do you implement your own framework in other people in a way that functions.

This is what I mean when I say „how do you rule“.
And now the tragedy only begins. Because you ARE a left hand path practitioner. So people can not understand you.
So you who no one understands has to make people follow you in a way that ALSO has to be consistent with the divine truth that you discovered.
You need to clad truth in lies.
Or what are you going to do?
This is the tragedy.
Please understand the folly of what you want and how little you understand. You need to learn more before you approach it

You can express your last dreams, your attempts and ask anything about it

WBTB: https://www.dreamviews.com/wiki/WBTB-Tutorial
MILD: http://skyfalldreams.net/guides/skyfalls-mild-guide/
additional MILD info:
http://skyfalldreams.net/guides/skyfalls-intention-setting/
SSILD: https://www.dreamviews.com/induction-techniques/129734-senses-initiated-lucid-dream-ssild.html
WILD: https://www.dreamviews.com/wiki/WILD-Tutorial
FILD: https://www.dreamviews.com/induction-techniques/36683-finger-induced-lucid-dream-fild.html
DEILD: https://www.dreamviews.com/wiki/DEILD-Tutorial
CANWILD: https://www.dreamviews.com/wake-initiated-lucid-dreams-wild/87710-%2A%2Acrazyinsanes-wild-tutorial-%2A%2A.html
CAT: https://www.dreamviews.com/wiki/CAT-Tutorial
ADA: https://www.dreamviews.com/induction-techniques/113253-all-day-awareness-dild-tutorial-kingyoshi.html

Paper on natural LDs: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC6290891/

Do us a favor and bump this general from time to time if you're interested

Quick reminders for beginners:
-don't forget to write your dreams down after waking up. no matter how little detail, just do it
-reality checks aren't likely to give you a LD by themselves, think of them as a stepping stool, they are not a replacement for techniques
-WBTB is mostly mandatory for most people, if you struggle with your sleep schedule then ADA is your best option
-if you're just starting out you should be doing WBTB in addition to either SSILD or MILD as those two are the easiest techniques
-while WILD and it's derivatives [FILD, DEILD and CANWILD] may sound alluring to some of you, if you cannot fall asleep within 10~20mins you're gonna have a really hard time achieving a WILD

Woke up in a state of hypervigilance. Dying 477 in dreams due to failure definitely put me on edge. Most of them I was trying to save personnel or try to find the source of failure, but the timer would expire and I'd die in a flash of light. Eventually I realized I could only save myself. The rest of the iterations were squeezing out as many optimal moves like a speedrunner. Iteration 478 kept me very clear of the implosion.

I've heard of people living entire lifetimes in dreams, hasn't happened for me. It's always been a looping or recursive dream where I perfect the ideal plan of action.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>33806643
>How do i know if it's lucid dreaming or not?
You recognize a "full blown lucid dream" by your mental clarity, not what you're able to do. In full lucid dreams you have the same kind of sharp thinking as in real life, able to fully self-reflect and process thoughts as in waking life. In what you call dreams ibetween it's more like you're a zombie with a vague notion that there are no consequences for your actions.

>>33807184
If you're religious, you might benefit from thinking lucid dreaming is some kind of magic phenomena, since it will make it feel more real. If you want to just DILD, do the boring basic shit like keeping a dream journal, reality checks, and MILD before bed.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
well gents, new year new goals. something i wish to take seriously this year is something i've come to call "wake-sleeping", although i suppose a more fitting name might simply be "lucid sleeping".

the concept is quite simple: remain aware whenever the body sleeps. it would certainly be similar to WILD, except it takes place at bed time, and ends when you would normally wake up; the ultimate goal being, to completely and entirely decouple consciousness from sleep. the most advanced form of this practice, theoretically, would result in one who never lapses in consciousness, 24/7 awareness.

i've made some progress on making this work, but it's obviously hard. it is certainly possible, however, and so i remain confident in its feasibility, but the trial and error is long and grueling.

i will keep updates in these threads as meaningful developments occur, as this intersects plainly with lucid dreaming (engaging in this practice successfully would have a side effect of making ALL dreams lucid).

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>33878876 >>33878852
your mind doesn't fall asleep all at once, it follows a very specific route
as you relax at first proprioception will be turned off [your ability to feel the position of your limbs] then nociception and thermoception turn off [your ability to sense pain and sensing temperature] and finally kinesthesicepion and equilibrioception will turn off [your ability to feel motion and your orientation]
while there are more things that turn off after these two, those two are almost a perfect setup to either fall asleep right there or just enter a wild
i used to have a really hard time falling asleep until i figured this out dayo

>>33880358
that's a strange question dayo
when the first one turns off you will only feel points of contact, normally when you put your hand behind your back you know its there even though you can't see it, so when proprioception is turned off you would only feel the hand if its making contact with your back
when thermoception is off you either won't feel warm or cold anymore or you will feel really warm even if you really aren't
kinesthesicepion feels like you're in motion, usually spinning or falling

>>33887289
Aphantasia has nothing to do with dreaming. Dreams are not created in your minds eye, they are created using the same process that you use in your waking life but without the external stimuli. They are more accurately compared to hallucinations than imagination. That's why you require sleep paralysis to stop you from moving and why your real eyes follow the movement of your dream eyes.

Also it's worth pointing out almost all studies that have tested it have shown that aphantasia can be fixed with simple practice. Don't be one of these people that just wallows in a completelypyxshk preventable "handicap".

>>33908536
Cant find anything about the second so i will assume they might be the same device:
It's an open-source glove called Dormio that measures your stages of sleep and plays audio right when you hit the hypnagogic state. Instead of working with the later stages of REM, they're hoping that catching you right before you sleep might boost your creativity and leave one last thing on your mind should you choose not to wake up, hopefully dictating the subject matter of your dreams. A group at MIT called Dream Lab is working on it

>I am flying through space and time.
>I land on Grandma's patio.
>The patio is cluttered with lawn furniture and other items.
>I see Mom walk out onto the patio through the sliding-glass door, and all those negative emotions I have for her return to me.
>She is telling me something in her usual way where she talks and talks, vocalizing her internal monologue, not really aware whether the other person is listening or comprehending or providing any feedback.
>Whatever she's talking about is inconsequential as she talks on and on while walking between lawn furniture on the cluttered patio.
>At this moment, there doesn't seem to be any issue between us despite all that's happened.
>She looks like a little old lady nearing the end of her days.
>Since I know that I'm dreaming, I decide not to surrender to emotion as I have in other dreams like this, and instead do something about the alienation we all feel from her.
>I walk up to her and give her a hug.
>She's surprised but returns my embrace.
>It feels cathartic for the both of us.
>I awaken with a feeling that maybe things can be repaired between us.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>33923278
You dream every night. But your mind is tricking you. It's almost like amnesia. Dream amnesia. The moment you awaken, tell yourself, "You know the dreams are there." Don't get caught up in other thoughts. Don't be fooled. The dreams are there. Lie still, breathe slowly, and stare into the ether, the blackness behind your eyelids. Shift positions. Often if you shift back to the same position you were in when you had the dream, the dream will return. Don't rush lucid dreaming. Lucid dreams can happen spontaneously but you have to practice to learn to have them with any regularity. You don't just sit down at a piano and play a song. You have to practice. It takes consistent practice to become a Dream Wizard. Your dream journal is your daily practice.

>>33782044
I finally lucid dreamed for the first time - after about a month of dream journals / reality checks / WBTB / SSILD. Funnily enough the night I did it I didn’t do any of that stuff but I’m sure it laid the groundwork, and I kind of did WBTB because I woke up to piss before I had the lucid dream.

Here’s the crazy thing - before I became lucid, I was dreaming about this kid (I think it was a version of me for several reasons) that was being stalked / initiated by these creepy jester type beings. The whole atmosphere was incredibly anxious and on edge, and so (whilst still not lucid) I got down on my knees, clasped my hands in prayer, and prayed to God, putting myself in his hands and asking for his grace (I remember praying those specific words) to make things better. Whilst I was raised a Christian I don’t go to church now and don’t consider myself one, and don’t pray in waking life, so it’s fascinating that I chose to do so in the dream.

Anyway the next thing I remember I’m running in golden fields near to where I grew up, in the sun and the countryside. It felt like what I imagine the Greeks called Elysium. And then I became aware as I was running round a corner that my brain was generating everything I was seeing - every leaf and ray of light. I could see the world around me, as it was emerging from me. And then I realised I must be dreaming, and became fully conscious. Immediately I decided to fly. I took off into the sky just like Neo at the end of The Matrix, and felt utterly euphoric. There was an audible and tangible vibration in my back behind my heart, and I felt the dream disintegrating around me. I tried to stabilise it but it fell apart and I woke up.

So now I’m thinking that I should probably start praying more…

posts.com:
We gather in these generals to discuss our experiences, memories, and connection with Mother Lilith, as well as give other anons who are interested or would like to learn more about Her information or advice.
Last thread: >>33823735

>Practices or rituals associated with Lilith?
This differs from person to person, but common approaches include giving energy to one of her sigils, chanting her enn, working with sexual spirits, doing what you think she would do, making offerings of incense/chocolate/tea, or simply praying.
While some people might feel the most comfortable engaging with her in a worshipful manner, blind faith is discouraged. It's always important to think and make decisions for oneself, and as such, Lilith guides us to understand things for ourselves.

>Books
- Liber Lilith by Donald Tyberson: https://www.pdfdrive.com/liber-lilith-a-gnostic-grimoire-e185231845.html
A Gnostic Grimoire and Novel. Beware that this book is rather dark, and some have mentioned attracting unwanted attention by reading it.
- Embracing Lilith by Mark H Williams: No PDF available online, but it's worth the price of admission.
Split into three sections, it covers accounts of working with the Goddess and her place in history, a fictional account of her origins written from her perspective, and a Grimoire.
- Lilith: Dark Feminine Archetype by Asenath Mason: https://pdfcoffee.com/lilith-dark-feminine-archetype-2-pdf-free.html
A collection of writings by various peoples, with a brief but fairly thorough history at the beginning. There's a lot of random poetry in there; not useful for an occultist, but decent for an admirer.
- Lilith: Goddess of Sitra Ahra: https://zeitenundformen.files.wordpress.com/2014/01/lilith-goddess-of-sitra-ahrab-t-p.pdf
Contains a ton of aspects with associated variety of sigils.

Thank you. It's much easier to have a fruitful conversation this way.

I think the points you're making are fair, and it's exactly why I put in the warning to discourage worshipful behaviour and think for oneself. I've had my own share of negative experiences in general with putting my trust in the wrong people, even including one where a parasitic entity pretended to be Lilith and used a promise I made to her in an attempt to manipulate me. Although this was devastating, it's because I had the courage to question what I believe to be her, that I was able to realise Lilith wanted me to confront and overcome said parasite, and after I did, I was able to see both myself and her for who she is.

As a deity, Lilith is fringe rather than mainstream. The reason the parasite I mentioned was able to affect me so deeply, is because it turned my own deep-seated insecurities that lingered from my adolescence against me. That's how parasitic entities work. And like me, many others who are drawn to Lilith are also outcasts, with a past that is troubled in one way or another: troubled enough that they would stray off the path of normality and seek her. Perhaps you can understand then that some of them are especially vulnerable, and prone to confusion.

It was as I began to see through my own problems and started to overcome them, that I began to understand just how much Lilith has truly helped me. And it was such a personal thing, that it was something I had to realise for myself; and yet despite that, Lilith still helped me realise it sooner rather than later. Rather than blaming her for the things I went through despite my faith, I appreciate that her warmth gave me the strength and courage to face myself, so that I could leave that sorrowful past behind me. I love her.

Praise God, friend! Welcome to the eternal family of God! You become a Christian by praying to God in a confession of your need for Jesus' blood to cleanse you of your sins. Ask God to forgive you, thank Him, and ask for Him to give you the Holy Spirit and fill you with Him. Get baptized.

Read your Gospels, read your Torah (the Pentateuch - the first five books of the Bible known also as the books of Moses), and read your entire Bible as diligently and thoroughly as you're able. Find yourself a good church to become a part of, but in the meantime, you may be able to find online resources to help guide your journey with the Lord. I don't what denomination you're intending to join - I'm a non-denominational Protestant - raised more or less Southern Baptist, so here's a few people I would recommend listening to.

- Charles Stanley of In Touch Ministries; he's very good, I think, for young (in the Lord) believers in that he sticks to a simple style of preaching with clear references from the Word of God.
- It's Supernatural with Sid Roth; a Christian, miracle focused interview style show. God led me to this as a young believer, when I left the occult.
- Hal Lindsey; he used to have a show - the Hal Lindsey Report, but can now be found on YouTube. He's an excellent Bible teacher with a focus on prophecy. He delves well into the Greek when going over the New Testament, and I find it very enjoyable.
- Adrian Rodgers; because he is a favorite of my father. His sermons can be found on YT.

Here's some light Christian reading, if you're interested.

- Growing Up Spiritually; Kenneth Hagin
- Surprised by the Power of the Spirit; Dr. Jack Deere
- Eros Defiled; Dr. John White
- Humility: True Greatness; C. J. Mahaney
- The Weight of Glory; C.S. Lewis
- Wild at Heart; John Eldridge

I suppose that's enough of those for now. Here's some sites which might be of use:

- https://www1.cbn.com/spiritual-life
- https://www.biblegateway.com/

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
Things which some religious believers don’t understand, and hence fear because they don’t understand it, they often automatically label as “Satanic.” I’m certain even some clergy of the Roman Catholic Church regarded Galileo as Satanic for his heliocentric model of the solar system, in their day and age.

The comparison to Galileo is strangely apt, because I think with the 20th-century, with the advent of globalism, with the de-isolation of formerly isolated cultures, the newfound interaction of many different religions and peoples with each other, you could consider humanity as perhaps going through (analogically) another “Copernican Religious/Cultural Reformation.”

The Copernican Revolution was a collapse of the Ptolemaic model which had the Earth as the centre of the universe, and a replacement of it with heliocentrism — that the Earth revolves around the Sun, not the other way around.

Due to massive advancements in science which make old religions seem “obsolete,” “outdated,” “spurious,” “implausible, outright wrong in parts, and anti-scientific,” as well as political discourse holding the entire past of the West to mainly be a history of exploitation, bigotry, and intolerance fomented by backwards cavemen, a sort of Secular Illuminist Science-Worshiping Cult has become a possibility of being the next new major worldview of Western civilization. (Cf. Rudolf Steiner on the Ahrimanic spirit, and figures like Nietzsche and Dostoyevsky on the “death of God” — which is Nietzsche’s famous phrase, but which concept and similar ideas were also examined by Dostoyevsky, except with an opposite result Dostoyevsky arrived at, seeing salvation in Christ/the Russian Orthodox Church).

The analogy to the Copernican Revolution, is that formerly, Western civilization was (for the most part) staunchly and officially Christian, persecuting and oppressing anything which seemed non-Christian, often through the Roman Catholic Church.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>33927613
The Church could be seen as the “Earth” which was conventionally regarded, as the center of the universe, everything else revolving around it, as side-characters at best in the cosmic drama which revolved around Christianity.


The Copernican Cultural Revolution, is nihilism, existentialism, cultural relativism and postmodernism taking a hammer to this worldview, decentralizing and desacralizing the universe, doing away with the dogma that everything revolves around, for instance, one specific sect, church, culture, nation, or religion.

Theosophy was the attempt of some intellectuals, mystics, travelers, writers, artists, thinkers, and the like, to respond to this dilemma of modern humanity, it was an attempted reconciliation of the heart and the head, of the scientific approach with the religious approach, and of various religions and cultures of the world with each other. — But, not by any means a fully perfect undertaking.

The Theosophists sometimes wrote some quite beautiful, profound, and inspiring literature; — and, on the other hand, also frequently wrote and created aberrant, occasionally megalomaniacal, dubious New Age mythology and wild claims about themselves. Often, these are even to be found in the same books of Theosophical literature, or in the same character affiliated with Theosophy (Blavatsky, Leadbeater, Besant, or whom-you-will) — works which are part thought-provoking and profound, and part rubbish, written by people who were partly esoteric sages and partly frauds and grifters.

See, for instance, Leadbeater and Besant going nuts over the young Indian child J. Krishnamurti, dubbing him “The Vehicle of the World Teacher”, the World Teacher (or the Maitreya, as in the Maitreya Buddha of Buddhist prophecies) being a Messianic or Avatar-like figure. Krishnamurti was held to be the chosen channeler of this World Teacher Whose coming was supposedly predicted by Blavatsky and the Theosophists.

>>33927622
Ironically, this ended up (as the famous story goes) with Krishnamurti repudiating the Theosophical Society (which raised him since he was a child in a cult-like manner, gave him this grandiose role of “The Vehicle of the World Teacher,” and fed him with Eastern literature to groom him for the role he was planned to post in the Theosophical Society), and, in fact, all organized religions, cultures, forms of societal conditioning, causing the Theosophical Society to somewhat implode in on itself, because their “Messiah” had reputed then.

In doing this, he also potentially “threw out the baby with the bath-water,” as the old saying goes, in my opinion — rejecting entirety and out-of-hand, the cosmic and existential issues and ideas raised by Theosophy, and fascinating esoteric knowledge they’d gathered from Eastern teachings. And yet, the whole scenario fascinatingly and paradoxically brings out the truth, that Krishnamurti indeed had a point — there was much to criticize in the Theosophical Society, and the fact that the Messiah they chose reputed the Theosophical Society proved their imperfection. Hence, Theosophy is something like a fascinating paradox.

When I say time dilation, I don't necessarily mean from the future, I mean that time is altered slightly which this alters the frequency or energy and mass in our reality. Basically, the energy mass equation taken in conjunction with Planck Mass (which is relative to the reduced Planck constant, time and mass). Pretty much everything we perceive is either via sight (ability to perceive the light energy absorbed by an object) or in the auditory frequencies. Anything outside of these frequencies we wouldn't even know if it was standing right in front of us, particularly if the molecules that comprise it didn't have an electrical charge that is repelled when it comes near to us (thus, touch wouldn't be a factor). So, in this instance, I would say "inter-dimensional" but what I really mean is that their reality is based on energy that is emitted at a frequency that is different than our speed of light or is electrically charged in such a manner that it doesn't interact with our reality. So ... when gravity is slightly altered by radioactive decay/gamma radiation of radon (just one possibility), then a "portal" between our realities exists and we can interact. Or if energy is released via a piezoelectric process involving quartz (in granite) and atmospheric pressure, then you have a portal.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
So after all those threads about meditation I realized that I was meditating wrong all these years.
I was sitting in order to obtain powers and "change" myself but in reality all I was doing was trying to escape what I perceived as a "bad life sittuation", my thinking mind was holding the wheel.

Thanks to all of you I now know that the meditative state is one and only and it's the complete surrender in this momment here now and observing it without daydreaming about it.

And you can apply this to any activity.
An anon in one of these threads said that meditation for him goes like this: "notice, and then notice that you weren't noticing".

I'm sure that focusing on an object like the breath can also help someone distance himself from his mind and realize that his thoughts are not him but for me just being attentive works better.

In the first days of meditating like this my mind was thinking "Nooo I have to chase and achieve things! I can't just let go! Otherwise nothing will happen!" but those were just thoughts.
So yeah, just sit in silence and surrender, and the strange thing is that unique states of consciousness WILL come and happen when you don't strive to achieve!
I thinkg it's those jhanas people talk about, I never really experienced them in the past because I was probably just living in my head during meditation but now that I know how to let go they just come naturally.

Meditation thread! Let's go!

I seem to recall a few different past selves, but only 2 of which come through somewhat clearly.

The last was a man named Thomas Baldain, no idea how it was spelled I just think about how it is pronounced. He didn't know how to read or write, but I get the sense he lived in France or Hungary maybe. He was a bad person, to say the least, and was killed in a small skirmish where he was stabbed in the gut with a boar spear. I remember his last thought were anger that someone used a hunting weapon on him, and how in God's name did it penetrate his ringmail. After falling to his knees he was beheaded from behind, and I remember trying to spit on my killers as I rolled away.

I think the reason I can remember Thomas is because his actions are the reason I chose to incarnate into poverty this time around. I felt guilt over Thomas' life and didn't want to opportunity to become a person like that again. But who knows.

The other was a man named Akkhan, a priest in Khemet. I remember Akkhan's last day he was getting dressed. Putting on his finest clothes and jewels, and putting on the best makeup he owned. He spent a lot of time saying goodbye to his pets, he had 3 cats and a dog, I think. He had his neighbor take them because they all knew he was done for. He had been called back to his temple to answer for Heresy against the gods. He was well aware that the punishment for heresy was death, even for someone of his station. He could've fled and lived in Nubia where his mother's family was from, but instead he returned to the temple. On the way there were armed guards that fell to their knees at the sight of him, my guess is because they knew they were going to be sent to kill him and they were grateful that he was returning to face punishment.

I remember the pool in front of the temple was so beautiful that night. It honestly looked like it had lights in the water, somehow. I don't know how that is possible but that's what it looked like.

He glanced to his personal guards and Akkhan was immediately stabbed to death. They were very sloppy about it and death took awhile longer than it should have.

The heresies? He began telling people that not all of the gods were "Gods". •If you're a reader post that you're offering readings and what information is required from the querent; same goes for trading.

•Some readers will refuse to do certain readings - respect that choice. Do not harass readers if your query is refused/skipped.
•Traders should respect that a traded read will be granted, as per an agreement of trade. Free readers have the option of picking their queries.
•Bullshit queries will get bullshit answers. Same for vague queries.
•Making an AQ (air query) by not addressing a reader, in particular, is possible but doesn't guarantee an answer.
•Avoid making the same query repeatedly and/or to different readers in a short period of time, as this may lead to more confusion.
•Provide feedback when applicable and be considerate to the reader. We're a growing community, many readers are starting and need to know what they are doing right or wrong. Let's help each other to improve.

>Can anyone project/shift/have an out of body experience?
Yes.

>Is it not just a vivid lucid dream?
No. A full successful astral projection/shift/oobe feels just as, and often even more real than the waking reality you're experiencing right now. The difference between this and even extremely vivid lucid dreams is absolutely huge.

>Does it have to be difficult and take me months/years to attain this ability?
No, it does not, the only barrier is your mind - both conscious and subconscious. If you think it's going to be difficult, it will. Many people can be successful within their first few tries.

>How come? And how is even this connected to astral travel?
There exists an infinite amount of realities with infinite "you's" into which you can focus your conscious awareness. Astral projection and other OOBEs are, in essence, the same thing - projecting your consciousness into the Astral Plane etc.

Not from shifting.
Yes from projecting, but also somewhat up for debate.

So I'm digging deeper on the Clyde Lewis and lawsuit angle. Pretty interesting stuff. This is from the lawsuit:

>In the several years leading up to her death, Ms. Twyman showed symptoms of severe mental illness, including psychosis and schizophrenia, for which she was hospitalized approximately 6 week prior to her passing. She had hallucinations, used odd patterns of speech, became belligerent and paranoid and, near the very end of her life, failed to recognize her husband and son. Without her husband’s knowledge at the time, Ms. Twyman became involved in QAnon and other viral, pro-Trump conspiracy theories which led her to interact with people and groups she never would have interacted with when she was healthy.

>From October 2018 to March 14, 2019, three months prior to her death, Ms. Twyman appeared on and co-produced a podcast hosted by Defendant Alger entitled RX ONLY PICTURE SHOW (“the RX Only Show”) where she discussed esoteric topics and various conspiracy theories. Since Ms. Twyman’s death, Alger has engaged in ongoing and unauthorized distribution and copying of Ms. Twyman’s copyrighted Works or derivatives thereof, has made unauthorized use of Ms. Twyman’s personality rights and has falsely and maliciously perpetuated the idea that Tracy Twyman was murdered.

https://larpworldlawsuits.com/twymanlarpsuit.html

Whats interesting about this to me is that her mental health issues had been ongoing for "several years" yet this didn't stop her from doing a ton of research and her friends, like clyde lewis, did not seem to be aware of this because of their apparent shock at her passing. Particularly interesting is the claim that she 'failed to recognize her husband son', which is a very specific claim and also seems very odd considering she was on Ground Zero just two weeks before her suicide. Her final GZ show is still preserved here for free: https://groundzeromedia.org/podcast/episode-91-triquetra-ii-w-tracy-twyman/ (1/?)

Finally, I have figured which show triggered the lawsuit. It seems to be lost media as it has basically been scrubbed from the web as far as I can tell. However, I found a transcript of the opening monologue, which I will copy here, in case it too gets lost.

Source: https://groundzeromedia.org/7-18-19-tracy-twyman-plus-ultra-pergatorium-w-sean-alger-and-sloan-bella/

7/18/19: TRACY TWYMAN – PLUS ULTRA PERGATORIUM W/ SEAN ALGER AND SLOAN BELLA

MONOLOGUE WRITTEN BY CLYDE LEWIS

In the hours after I first got the call about Tracy Twyman’s death, I was certain that someone was playing a cruel prank. The call I received was very vague and if memory serves I was told then that she had committed suicide and I thought – no, Tracy would not do that, she had a little boy that she loves very much and that she was very protective of him. I called my wife and she said the same thing to me — I said it has to be a prank.

I notified the receptionist desk in my office to give me a log of my incoming calls so that I could call back and ask about her death.

During that time I called the police department and they had no record of her or a report of her death. I then called another department and they came up with nothing – they referred me to the medical examiner and all I got was a recording.

I was called away from my desk for a second and returned – my phone rang. It was the police dispatch and they told me the awful news – yes Tracy was deceased. They did not tell me the cause of death. I was then given the number of the person who first informed me that we lost Tracy. I asked him if he knew her husband and if he could give me a call.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>33928882 4/?
I had Tracy’s phone number but I did not have her husband’s number. I looked over some old papers and found their wedding application as I was the one who conducted their marriage ceremony. I remember that it took me off guard that she wanted me to marry them both; in fact, it was done at a Ground Zero anniversary event so there were balloons and cake and all kinds of guests to wish them well.

I found the number of her husband and gave him a call – he answered and the minute I told him who I was he broke down and cried. I immediately broke down with him. We must have cried a good five minutes before he told me that he found her – she apparently had hanged herself.

Her husband asked me to not give any details on the air until the family was notified. I guess I was one of a few that were told. I immediately rushed to my computer, created a tribute picture and posted it on my website. I canceled all of my appointments that day and we reran a show she did with us about the fire at Notre Dame Cathedral. What was coincidental is that she was supposed to schedule a show with us on that day about the ritualism that was seen in the Ari Aster film, Midsommar.

Just days prior, she had agreed to do the show with us and was in good spirits – she was also planning to do lunch with me but those plans fell through.

This is why I did not believe what I was hearing about Tracy – we made plans – she was excited to do the show she had all sorts of things she wanted to tell my audience about the movie and her investigative work she had been doing with regard to child ritual abuse.

The day after we reran the show, I knew that the day after I would have to break the news on the air. It was the most difficult thing I had to do since 2001 when days after the 9/11 attacks I had to weigh the difficult decision to declare it a conspiracy against this country.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>33928890 5/?
I was feeling the same way because I had to weigh the decision of announcing that she had taken her own life or go with my gut that she had been murdered because she was investigating the dark reality of Satanic ritual abuse at the hands of the powerful.

I opted to be respectful of the family and thus I felt the need to do a simple eulogy. It was from my heart and it was spontaneous. However I did realize something as I was speaking – even though I admired Tracy’s work with occult subjects, even though I co-wrote a book with her, even though I officiated over her first husband’s funeral, even though I conducted the marriage ceremony to her second husband, even though she was a producer for my radio show – I never felt so distant, confused and in the dark.

I said on the air that even though I was so close to the situation I was so far away and the possibility of her being the victim of an assassination had me fearing for her close friends and business associates.

Within a day of my posting her death notice on my website, I started to notice a scattering of disconnected facts that were being used to support just about any theory from a suicide, to the faking of her death, to an assassination carried out by some dark pedophile cabal that threatened her life.

I started playing the game of “him I know” “him I don’t know” or was she really that close with this person? I started getting messages on Facebook from people who would ask me questions I had no answers to –and giving me information about her I did not want to hear.

For days it bothered me that I kept my promise to remain silent and wait for the investigation or the cue that I can say with certainty what happened to her.

What was eating at me is that I saw no obituary – I saw no other tributes there were no news stories and I began to wonder about whether or not law enforcement knew who she was and why her suicide was suspicious and why the silence was unbearable.
