>>33928896 6/?
Twyman was a prolific author and commentator – she appeared in a movie I was involved with called, Bloodline, and we made an appearance together on Conspiracy Theory with Jesse Ventura.

I was first hooked on her work with the book Merovingian Mythos and I had picked up a copy of her cult zine, Dagobert’s Revenge, when I was younger.

I remember when I found out she lived in the Pacific Northwest – I realized that I had to meet her – I had to have her on my show and her first real in-depth interview on my show was about the missing of alchemy and economics. She was promoting her book, Money Grows on the Tree of Knowledge.

Once during many of our talks, she brought up an interview that I did in 2005 with Rolling Stone magazine about my research into the Antichrist coming from the British Royal Family.

We wrote a small book together called, Antichrist 2012 – that went out of print but the information that I gleaned from it became a powerpoint lecture I did called, The AC/DC God. In fact, she was in the audience when I presented it ironically enough in a Masonic Lodge.

When I had cancer for my 3rd time, she visited me and got to know my then long-time girlfriend Janine. They became friends and after I recovered, I invited her to be the producer of Ground Zero.

When she was the producer of the show we had many interesting shows about the occult, we would use Ouija boards—I would attend occult gatherings and meet people that were well known in the fields of magic and conspiracy theory.

Of course, working with Tracy invited controversy.

Her background in the occult, her relationship with Boyd Rice a known Satanist – her investigation into Merovingian mythos and her work in uncovering Satanic Ritual Abuse had some amateur conspiracy theorists spinning stories about her being my handler; that she had me under some sort of spell and that she controlled the show and made it a tool for Satan

Well no, that was not true.

Tracy was a warrior and was not afraid to climb into the abyss to get to the ugly truth. I was so surprised at how resilient she was and how efficient she was as a producer and a contributor to many of my shows, imparting knowledge about the occult, symbolism and even synchronicity.

Then one day she came into the office – she started clearing out her desk and she said I can no longer work here. I was shocked. I said was there something I said or was there something I did.

I asked from what – she said she would meet with me to tell me about how she was involved with exposing a group of very bad people. When I met her at a park, she seemed nervous and paranoid. She was very protective of her son.

She informed me that someone was harassing her online, that she felt like she had been targeted. I tried to assure her that she would be okay but she told me that I did not understand.

Apparently, I didn’t – I was unaware of how deep the rabbit hole went for her. I kept in contact with her and even invited her to share her work at a speaking engagement called Ground Zero University. It was very dark and was implicating the British elite in a pedophile scandal.

This was around the same time that Max Spiers had died – many may not remember that he was involved with exposing both British and American power brokers involved with drugs and human trafficking.

He died a horrible death where he vomited up black liquid. Police say that he was suicidal but his associated believed that he was the victim of a black magic spell.

It then became the common conspiracy theory that certain people in the media were trying to expose the power elite’s penchant for young boys and girls were found dead of apparent suicides.

posts.com:
The number 33 is considered to be a sacred or significant number in several religious traditions. Some examples include:

Hinduism:
In Hinduism, 33 is considered to be a sacred number because it is associated with the 33 gods of the Vedas, who are believed to be the highest deities in the Hindu pantheon. The number 33 is also believed to symbolize the ultimate attainment of spiritual enlightenment and the realization of the ultimate goal of life, which is union with the divine. I also encountered it in the Upanishads.

Buddhism:
In Buddhism, the number 33 is often associated with the 33 celestial abodes of the Buddha, which are believed to be realms of existence in the heavenly realm. These celestial abodes are said to be inhabited by beings who have attained a high level of spiritual development and are on the path to enlightenment.

Christianity: In Christianity, the number 33 is sometimes seen as a symbol of the age of Jesus at the time of his death. This interpretation is based on the belief that Jesus was crucified at the age of 33. One example of the number 33 appearing in the Bible is in the New Testament, where it is mentioned as the age of Jesus at the time of his death. According to the Gospel of Luke, Jesus "began to be about thirty years of age" (Luke 3:23) and "suffered under Pontius Pilate, was crucified, dead, and buried" (Acts 2:23) at the age of 33.

Islam: In Islam, the number 33 is sometimes seen as a symbol of the 99 names of Allah, which are believed to represent the attributes and qualities of God. One example of the number 33 appearing in the Quran is in Surah Al-Ahzab, where it is mentioned that there were 33 companions of the Prophet Muhammad who pledged allegiance to him at the event known as the "Pledge of Al-Aqaba." These companions are considered to be among the most prominent and influential followers of the Prophet Muhammad, and are highly respected and revered in Islamic tradition.

Sikhism: In Sikhism, the number 33 is sometimes seen as a symbol of the 33 million gods and goddesses that are believed to exist in the Sikh pantheon.

>>33929031
Because then he would not be a god, and the question would not be about polytheism at all: it would be about whether or not it is theologically correct to label Mars as an angel (although I think OP would still be guilty of idolatry).

As a target of veneration, a god is an active entity: The power, although ultimately coming from the Demiurge (if you're a neoplatonist, anyway), belongs to Mars, and he is the actor in this case: he decides whether to use his powers to help you or not. A saint merely presents your case to the God, who makes that decision. You can think of it as a judge vs. an advocate: Mars is a judge. Although there may be higher beings you can theoretically appeal to if you think he has erred (Jupiter, in this case: demiurge is generally considered to not take active interest in the world he has created), he's the one who makes the decision on your case. In Christianity, a saint or an angel is merely an advocate: if he agrees to take the case, that only means he presents it to God, who is the one who actually makes the decision.

>>33917245
I did the math for the voyage below. If I made a mistake please correct me, I’m pretty sure I got it right tho:

Katharsis II (Oyster 72): Speed recorded (Max / Average): 9.5 knots / 7.7 knots
7.7 knots = 8.861 mph
9.5 knots = 10.932 mph

Antarctic Circumpolar current average speed: 2.5 mph (fastest current in the world moving with the direction of the boat race)

This means the average speed of the the yatch would have been 10.2mph
Top speed would have been 13.43mph

Circumference at 60th south parallel is 12,482 miles (keep in mind the actual distance traversed would have been even shorter bc the route traveled was SOUTH of the 60th parallel)

12,482 miles / 10.2 (average speed) = 1,223.7 hours
1,223.7 hours / 24 = 50.9 days

12,482 miles / 13.43 (top speed) = 931.49 hours
931.49 hours / 24 = 38 days

Average speed traveled over a 72.4 day voyage traveling 12,482 miles:
12,482 / 72.4 = 172.4 miles per day
172.4 / 24= 7.18 mph

>Average speed of yatch with circumpolar current is 10.2mph

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>33922744
A blizzard is a strong wind (how strong depending on who is talking—in the U.S. the minimum is 35mph) carrying enough snow to greatly reduce visibility.

Most blizzards in Antarctica occur near the edges of the continent, where katabatic winds (essentially cold air flowing downhill) raise drift (dust formed from powdered snow) and reduce visibility to as little as zero, where you cannot see your own hands.

Wind frequently reaches 120 knots (the wind speed of a category 4 hurricane) in gusts, blowing several hours at 100 knots, with sustained speeds of 60 knots for 24 hours or more not uncommon near the coast. Further inland (50 miles or 80km from the coast) wind speeds might be half as high.

>In proxy wars, the principle of mutual escalation can play out in a number of ways. One way is that states may provide military aid and support to different factions in a conflict, in order to increase the capabilities of their proxies and gain an advantage in the war. This can lead to a situation where multiple states are providing support to different factions in the war, leading to an escalation of the conflict as the various proxies become better equipped and more capable of fighting.

>Another way the principle can play out is that states may intervene directly in a proxy war if they feel that their proxies are losing and their interests are at risk. This can lead to a rapid escalation of the conflict as multiple states become directly involved in the fighting.

>Additionally, the principle of mutual escalation can also be seen in the proxy wars when states or non-state actors, who are supported by different states, starts escalating the war by using more advanced weapons, tactics and bringing in more fighters. This will lead to increase in destruction and loss of lives, which will force the states to increase their involvement, thus escalating the war further.

In both cases, the principle of mutual escalation can lead to a situation where the proxy war becomes more destructive, more widespread and more difficult to resolve as the various states and factions become more deeply entrenched in the conflict.
